reviews.text: The waitressâ€™s attitude was awful â€” it felt like I owed her money or something. She looked down on me while taking my order. I asked for a serving of xiaolongbao, and she told me sheâ€™d give me one for free. What, do I look like I canâ€™t afford it?
Huge servings. Family style. Great flavor. Everyone left full and happy.

Soup dumplings and a myriad of chinese delicacies including soups, noodles, roasted meats. I had the complimentary soup dim sum after ordering chinese meatballs and shrimp in rice noodles. It was delicioulsy served steaming hot in Bamboo steam trays. Service was prompt, friendly, and accomodating. This cash only emporium is a must try if you puruse the samplings on 40th road in Flushing, China Town. Great eats, priced right!
Delicious dumplings.  Friendly staffs.  Always a long  wait for table but it's worth the wait.
The food in the restaurant is not suitable for everyone and tastes a bit sweet
wo xi huan xiao long bao w Anna :D got a free  soup dumpling too. Bussin 9.5/10
Es lo mÃ¡s asqueroso q e visto  en este restaurante. Ordene comida  y vino con cucaracha  en el plato

Very decent food for outdoor dining in the midst of winter. There's positive pandemic pricing where u get a basket of 6 Shanghai soup dumplings gratis if u spend over $10

I went there again with my wife & a friend on 10/10/25. We had 1/2 of the Peking duck that came along with the 6 soup dumplings, gratis. We had this beef tripe dish, which I didn't lime too much. My friend order some savory soy soup. That was OK. The Shanghai chicken, which looks like Hainese chicken, doesn't taste as good as the latter. We also had shui Mai, which is not as tasty as some other dim sum places. For vegetables we had the pea sprouts. The best was the Peking duck & the soup dumplings.  For some reason the shredded cucumber they serve for the Peking duck doesn't look too fresh. It was translucent as if it was kept in the freezer for quite some times.
Everything we had was delicious.

Absolutely love this place. Shanghai You Garden might look like any ordinary Chinese restaurant from the outside, but itâ€™s easily one of the most heartwarming dining experiences Iâ€™ve had in New York. The food quality is way above expectations, my scallion noodles even had shrimp the size of the ones youâ€™d find back in Taiwan. I ordered just $12 worth of food (rice rolls and beef balls), and they surprised me with extra soup dumplings and sweet rice wine balls. In a city that can feel cold and rushed, this place served me genuine warmth and care. Truly a 5 star kind of comfort that makes you feel seen, full, and grateful.

A must-stop in Flushing. There's nothing like Shanghai You Garden duck ğŸ¦† buns and soup ğŸ¥Ÿ for breakfast for an authentic Chinese experience. There's something heartwarming and inspiring about walking into this huge restaurant early in the morning and seeing elderly Chinese couples sitting down and enjoying breakfast. You can grab their 2.75$ duck buns at the window takeout but I will offer you to step inside. They have a free set of dumplings ğŸ¥Ÿ on each set you orders. We loved the duck ğŸ¦† buns ( mine wasnâ€™t the first time ğŸ˜ƒğŸ¥°ğŸ¤—) and the soup dumplings were delicious and so comforting. The staff is welcoming and friendly and the Tea they served as basic treat was good too. Donâ€™t miss this place ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜ƒ
I flew in from Florida this morning just to eat here.  Shanghai you Garden never disappoints and always delivers a great meal. From the dumplings to the duck and fried rice. It's all fantastic!
Excelente opciÃ³n para comida china y a un buen precio. Hay muchas opciones en la carta con gran sabor.

Arrived at the restaurant at 9:00 PM on a Saturday, both the Google page and sign outside the door said the restaurant would be closing at 10:00 PM. When we walked in we were seated by the host and given menus. After sitting down for a moment a man approached our table and told us the restaurant was closing at 9:30 because they needed to â€œcleanâ€ and that we should leave, donâ€™t restaurants need to be cleaned EVERY night? If you want to close at 9:30 change the hours posted outside and on your website. I have eaten at this restaurant before but after my experience this time I wonâ€™t be returning.

I went there this morning and the experience was mediocre food, ok services with some attitude issues of the server who attended us obviously not great and seemingly cozy seating without privacy that got quite noisy for conversation.   I would have rated this restaurant just 2.75 stars  more precisely if without considering the reasonable prices overall. The worse part to me is that the tables are way too close to each other that it is like sharing a table with strangers!
Excellent service. Very convenient. The soup dumplings are divine. Get the friend croaker, you'll thank me.
very reasonably priced food with huge portions, do not order the tourist stuff because you're going to miss out on the other amazing dishes -- their stir fried udon is amazing over here

My family wanted dumplings and dumplings were had and dim sum. The menu is ginormous. There are so many options. We needed more time twice after the waiter asked what we wanted. The meals are served family style which encourages conversation. The wait staff was so attentive because they didn't bring all the food out at once. Once we were almost done with a dish, the rest of what we ordered came out. It was a great experience. The only bummer is that it is cash only, but they have zelle and venmo options which helped. I'll definitely be going back with my family.
æœ‹å‹æ¨èè¿™é‡Œï¼Œèœå“ä¸é”™ğŸ‘
æ¨èå°ç¬¼åŒ…
Budget friendly,  tasty duck buns and soup dumplings.

If you dine in and spend $10, you can get a free duck bun or an order of soup dumplings!! WOW. We also ordered an order of their new spicy pork dumpling flavor but preferred their original pork over the spicy. The soup dumplings are always great. We also ordered half of a roasted duck which is enough meat to feed about 7 servings (several extra buns but not enough meat). CASH ONLY with an ATM on site. Their other dishes are also very yummy to try. They also gave us a FREE dessert soup - warm and sweet with small glutinous balls.

Iâ€™ve visited this spot many times over the years, and it has always been one of my favorites in Flushing Chinatown. The prices are reasonable, the staff are friendly, and the menu offers a wide variety of choices. Sadly, Iâ€™ve noticed that the food quality has started to decline compared to past visits. The wonton and noodles, which used to be my go-to dishes, are no longer as flavorful or satisfying as they once were. I still enjoy coming here, but I really hope the kitchen returns to the high standard that made this place so special.
Great food and very reasonable price

Iâ€™ve eaten here a few times and the Shanghainese food at this Flushing location is much better than at the Bayside location, which tends to over salt. Some tasty dishes that were enjoyed there include the jellyfish (tender and seasoned well with a little sesame oil), salty soybean and sweet soybean milk (both were good), sautÃ©ed tofu with preserved egg, crystal shrimp, ribbon fish, fried yellow croaker, and pan fried noodles.
Lot of things and Nice stuff
I ordered food for pickup on DoorDash and half my meal was non edible the pan fried pork buns were soo burnt. Idk but I canâ€™t believe they would serve that.

The soup dumplings (better than din tai fung) are really good and same with the duck buns!! We came back  a second trip to flushing for it. The other stuff is okay- try somewhere else for stinky tofu and rice rolls.  They give you free tea and sweet rice soup w sticky rice balls.  Also, their current special is if you spend 10$ they give you the soup dumplings for free - yum!! I would come again!

Amazing place! The soup dumplings are soo good. They have a deal where if you spend more than $10, youâ€™ll can choose to get free soup dumplings or Peking duck bun (per person). At the end, they even gave us a complementary dessert. Highly recommend to check this place out.
Always our go to place for solid Shanghai food. Xiao long baos are my favorite as well as the scallion pancake.
We ordered the Peking Duck buns for to-go, and each piece is $2.75! I wasn't sure if it was worth the hype, but my friend said it's so good and want more. I do appreciate the easy grab-and-go style
Their Peking duck bun ($2.75 per piece) is "must try item", juicy duck meat with sweet sauce. Also swevice is good

I came at around 10:30 for a late breakfast and ordered the pan-fried pork buns, scallion pancakes with beef and iced soymilk. This was already too much for one so I anticipated having leftovers.

I had no idea that I crossed some monetary threshold for an order of free soup dumplings! Keep this in mind if you're solo dining...

The scallion pancakes were delicious and the pork buns very good (not my fave in Flushing, but solid). The soup dumplings were good and the soymilk was the perfect amount of sweet. I also like their chili...heavy on the crisp and light on the oil.

The restaurant was well lit and clean and the service was efficient and pretty friendly by Flushing stardards. I would definitely return (with friends).
The price was right! The staff are incredibly nice and you get your food quickly. We will be back!
Excellent service and delicious duck
Delicious dumplings!! ğŸ¥Ÿ
It's crazy how you guys literally gave me raw meat and refused to refund, even the sticky rice was undercooked, good job YuYuan
i love their scallion pancake with beef  & their homemade soymilk

Was in Flushing and found this restaurant on Google maps was highly rated and decided to try. Was a hidden gem, the front of the restaurant was completely empty, but bustling in the back. Food was great and reasonably priced. The soup dumplings were not as good as others Iâ€™ve had and would not order again as the filling and the soup lacked flavor. However, the duck was delicious (even though it didnâ€™t have much meat), the spicy tripe and beef was tender and tasty, the fried scallion and shrimp dumplings  were delicious and would recommend. Our family of 4 ate for less than $85 all in (tax and tip). Itâ€™s cash only, btw!

No visit to Flushing is complete without lunch at Shanghai You Garden. With one order of a Peking Duck Bun along comes six Pork Soup Dumplings in a steamer basket. It is free. Yes! Absolutely free and tasty. When a friend had rhapsodized about the cuisine here, I made sure to venture to Queens and spend the day exploring and eating. This time I also ordered the Chive and Shrimp Pancake which was a tad greasy. With a crisp wrapper, it was toothsome and every bite made me joyous. Only the shrimp rice roll was disappointing as the wrapper was too thick. Service is efficient and unobtrusive. A clean restroom (washroom) is located in the back. During the summer months one can order these duck baos and sit outside in the front to enjoy it. There are countless restaurants in Flushing but Shanghai You Garden remains one of my favorites. This is a cash only restaurant and my bill is always inexpensive. What more can one ask for?

Shanghai You Garden serves good and authentic Chinese breakfast. My parents are a fan and always prompts us to come here. Their menu is huge, but when you order enough, they will give you 6 soup dumplings or peking duck bun for free. I'm a huge fan of their salted tofu. The staff are always available if you need help.

I will say though, after eating here, you will experience food coma. The food is also a tad oily so you may feel bloated.

Got to say, they serve some really stinky tofu. The peking duck bun booth is very famous. Was seated upstairs in the bit more bare bones dining area. Went for the free buns instead of soup dumpling, and ordered a ton of dishes from my childhood. Everything has subtle delicate flavors letting ingredients shine without being overpowered by spices. Service a bit slow and unattentive, took a while to get the bill but that's not why you come here.
Interior was nice. Good food at decent prices. Kind of wish they put a bigger jellyfish portion compared to the pickled radish. Soup dumplings were delicious though!

Omg this place is literally heaven, let me tell you everything was cooked to perfection.The dumplings tasted amazing, the duck was the star of the show, every bite melted in your mouth. The noodles and fried rice was also delicious.

Had a late lunch Herr. We visited based on the reviews. The soup during were eh..at best,. They were doughy, and not flavorful. Some didn't even have broth. The food came very quickly. Scallion pancake was good, stir fry udon noodles and braised pork was OK. Saw a roach on my way back from the bathroom. Would not eat here again. Condiments on the table had food smears.

Stopped by to grab their $2 (they're $2.75 now) duck buns and ended up sitting inside and grabbing their soup dumplings. They had a deal for a free set of regular dumplings so we tried their spring special dumplings and regular and both were very tasty. Larger than the others I've seen, tasty broth, fun flavors. Tea was tasty, service was actually really nice and helpful, they even gave us a free "dessert" soup. Definitely recommend this spot.

Good place for various dim sum dishes, including fried buns and dumplings. They also had a promotion going on for free Peking duck buns with purchase, which were really flavorful. We went when it opened, so there wasnâ€™t much of a crowd. Cash only.

In short: Great food, 2 free items were gifted, blunt and to the point service. Flavor profile of dumplings below.

We got the sesame bun and the fried bun with eggs and chives. The sesame buns are HUGE!! And the fried bun is super flavorful. I definitely recommend!
Also, I recommend the lucky six soup dumplings to try all the flavors. But here are the flavor profiles anyways:

Gray- ok flavor and the mushroom has an octopus like texture

Blue- cilantro, fragrant  almost tea-like (dont eat if you have the gene that makes cilantro taste like soap)

Yellow- crab flavor and very rich

Red and white- light shrimp flavor and very rich

Green- very vegetal flavor did not personally like

Red- light spice very aromatic and flavorful

One of my favorite restaurants in Flushing. The best dish is their affordable whole duck. Comes with a free soup dumpling and dessert soup too. Ended up spending under $100 to feed 5 adults.

A definitely must try if your in Flushing and have a duck craving.

Fyi, this place only takes cash or Venmo . No Credit cards.

Shanghai You Garden â€” Flushing, Queens is the location. Came hungry! Left in a dumpling coma. Hereâ€™s what I devoured â¬‡ï¸

ğŸ¥Ÿ Lucky 6 Soup Dumplings
A colorful sampler with six surprise flavors. Each one a little burst of magic. Pro tip: bite, slurp, then chew.

ğŸ¥Ÿ Pork Soup Dumplings
The OG. Thin skin, juicy pork, hot savory broth. A flawless classic that never disappoints.

ğŸ¥© Beef Pan-Fried Udon Noodles
Wok-fried with beef and veggies. Chewy, saucy, and full of that smoky â€œwok heiâ€ flavor.

ğŸ– Grandmaâ€™s Style Braised Pork -
Braised pork belly that melts on contact. Sweet, savory, rich, tastes like home (even if itâ€™s not yours).

ğŸ” General Tsoâ€™s Chicken -
Crispy on the outside, tender inside, and dripping in tangy-sweet heat. Never misses.

ğŸ¡ Glutinous Rice Cake
Chewy, lightly crisped, and just a hint of sweetness. A fun texture break between mains and dessert.

ğŸ® Rice Pudding
Warm, creamy, and not too sweet. The perfect soft landing after a savory feast. Hits the soul!

Flushing does it again! Shanghai You Garden is a perfect place for some sit down Chinese favorites. I still owe myself a sample of their rice dishes, duck, and more dumplings!

First timer at the place. Great food- delicious. Nice and polite service. Complementary dumplings, pot of tea & desert. Thanks a lot.
Highly recommend!

This is the spot for quick Shanghainese food in Flushing, thereâ€™s always a line and the highlights are the xiao Lun Bao, Beef Noodle soup and amazing appetizers.
We love the many variety of menus from beef scallions pancakes to Chive cakes and amazing Stinky Tofu to the soy bean milk.

peking duck was amazing and the shrimp in the roll was very fresh. service was fast and the duck came with free soup dumplings (6pcs). ribs were also good. would definitely go back to try their other stuff.

I came here for dinner one day and it was pretty decent. Service was pretty quick and the interior of the restaurant is pretty casualâ€”your standard Chinese spot.

I got the pan fried pork dumplings, pork XLB, lucky garden XLB, sticky rice siu mai, and their Peking duck. Everything was decent. The pan fried dumplings were very doughy but the meat was juicy and flavorful. The XLB were all great and I loved the broth, but if I were to come back I would only get their pork XLB. The sticky rice siu mai was a miss, as it wasn't very flavorful. And, the peking duck was alright. Although it was good, it was a bit too oily for me and wasn't crispy at all. Good price though! Also note that they only accept cash or Venmo here.

Get FREE soup dumplings when you spend over $10 â€” yep, basically FREE!!

Shanghai You Garden has been my familyâ€™s go-to spot in Flushing for years. If youâ€™re craving authentic Shanghainese food with affordable prices and fast service, this is the place to be.

If youâ€™re a first timer, I highly recommend their xiao long bao, sheng jian bao, and shanghai pork mooncakes.

On our latest visit, we were genuinely impressed. The food and dining atmosphere felt even better than before.

ï¼ŠCrab Meat Soup Filled Bun èŸ¹ç²‰çŒæ¹¯åŒ… $6.95
ï¼ŠAbalone and Crab Meat Soup Filled Bun é®‘é­šèŸ¹ç²‰çŒæ¹¯åŒ… $8.95
Basically, itâ€™s a giant version of a regular soup dumpling. Guan tang bao (çŒæ¹¯åŒ…) is hard to find because the making process is much more intricate. Be sure to use the straws they provide to sip the broth before digging in.

ï¼ŠPan Fried Pork Bun ç”Ÿç…åŒ… $9.50 **
A lovely crispy, golden bottom. My aunt thought it was a bit too burnt, but I loved the satisfying crunch. The bao was fluffy and packed with juicy pork filling. Definitely a must-try!

ï¼ŠCrab Meat & Pork Soup Dumpling èŸ¹ç²‰å°ç± åŒ… $10.95 *
ï¼ŠPork Soup Dumpling é®®è‚‰å°ç± åŒ… (free) *
Possibly the juiciest xiao long bao Iâ€™ve ever had! Iâ€™m amazed at how they pack so much broth inside without the wrapper feeling too thick.

ï¼ŠPork Mooncake æœˆé¤… $3/pc **
Last Mid-Autumn Festival, I made a special trip to Flushing just to get their mooncakes. Unlike Cantonese mooncakes filled with lotus paste and egg yolk, Shanghainese mooncakes have a flaky pastry and savory filling.

ï¼ŠRed Bean Rice Cake æ¢é ­ç³• $1.95/pc
ï¼ŠPurple Sweet Potato Mochi w. Salted Egg Lava ç´«è–¯æµæ²™åœ˜ $4/pc
We tried two of their mochi desserts, which were served warm and wrapped in plastic to keep them from drying out. Both were enjoyable, especially if youâ€™re into snacks that arenâ€™t too sweet.

ï¼ŠFermented Glutinous Rice Dumpling $7.95
Every time, weâ€™re treated to their é…’é‡€åœ“å­. While they taste just okay, I canâ€™t say no to freebies.

ï¼ŠFried Bean Gluten ä¸Šæµ·çƒ¤éº© $10.95 **
ï¼ŠSweet and Sour Rib ç³–é†‹æ’éª¨ $17.95 **
ï¼ŠSpiced Beef Shank äº”é¦™ç‰›å±• $13.95
ï¼ŠSalted Soy Bean Milk é¹¹è±†æ¼¿ $4.50

- - - - - -

After discovering this place, I will never spend an hour waiting for table at Nan Xiang anymore. Your mouth is ready to water over every dish here. They offer attractive dine-in promotion: If you spend over $10, you can enjoy Pork Soup Dumplings/Peking Duck Bun for freeâ€¼ï¸ They also serve free Fermented Glutinous Rice Dumpling (é…’é‡€ä¸¸å­), which is a kind of sweet and mild-alcoholic dessert soup.

ï¼Š Fried Bean Gluten çƒ¤éº© **
You can never go wrong with this cold appetizer at any Shanghainese restaurant.

ï¼Š Pan Fried Pork Bun ä¸Šæµ·ç”Ÿç…åŒ… **
My fav among all. The juicy ground pork was wrapped with a fluffy bun with a golden crispy bottom. They also spread some black sesame and chopped scallion on top, which further enhanced the complexity of flavors.

ï¼Š Pork Soup Dumpling è±«åœ’å°ç± åŒ…
Arrived fresh out of the bamboo basket. Even though we got it for free, the taste and servings were still satisfactory. The wrapper was pretty thick, but the dumplings were enclosed with delicious broth and meat fillings.

ï¼Š Pan Fried Chives & Shrimp Dumplings éŸ­èœé®®è¦ç…é¤ƒ **
Inside the crispy and chewy wrapper, they were filled with hearty shrimps and chives!

ï¼Š Pork Vegetable Wonton in Chilli Oil & Peanut Sauce ç´…æ²¹æŠ„æ‰‹
The biggest Sichuan wontons Iâ€™ve ever seen! It was also my first time enjoying it with peanut butter sauce. What a pity that their chilli oil wasnâ€™t spicy at all.

ï¼Š Sweet Soy Bean Milk ç”œè±†æ¼¿

Skip:
ï¼Š Braised Fish ç‡»é­š
Too many fish bones.

ï¼Š Deep Fried Sesame Ball èŠéº»çƒ
Nth impressive. Just an ordinary fried sesame ball with red bean lotus filling.

Their service was prompt and welcoming. Our food came piping hot within 10 mins after we ordered, except the pan fried pork bun which took a bit longer. Our server was so humorous lol his dad jokes made our day.

This breakfast restaurant is amazing. Thank them for giving me the last warm breakfast of my last NY trip. Everything tasted great and authentic. They gave free pork soup dumplings for each table. I really loved their dumplings and tofu puddings. Dim sum was also delicious.
Delicious spicy pork soup dumplings. Tasty broth. Also free soup dumping and a sweet dessert soup. Enjoyed all we tried and quick service.

Highly recommend visiting when youâ€™re in flushing! Reasonably priced with so many wonderful options to choose from. We went with ordering a couple of appetizers and roast pork. Everything was delicious especially the warm sweet tofu. The staff were giving out free soup dumplings (maybe because it was before CNY?!) and dessert.  Ended up taking a lot back home and thinking of when to visit next!

Those is a local restaurant in Bayside Queens that I had lunch with a friend. You can stop in for lunch or take out since itâ€™s set up for both.

I highly recommend sitting down and having a delicious meal at this restaurant. A bonus is youâ€™ll get a free order of fantastic Soup Dumplings with your meal. They have a wide variety of soup dumplings to choose from plus lots of other appetizers and entrees.

When my meal ended I took home half a duck and a pound of barbecue pork that they cut up in front of me. They were delicious as well.

If Iâ€™m in the neighborhood Iâ€™ll definitely eat here again!!!

Some of the best dumplings/dim sum in Queens, highly recommend!! We went on a Saturday night and had no problem getting a table. Everything is reasonably priced and the atmosphere feels authentic & relaxed. We got some complimentary apps, dessert, & tea with our meal as well.

âœ¨ï¸FREE Soup Dumplings + Dessert in NYC?! ğŸ˜³

Shanghai You Garden in Flushing is known for some of the best, most authentic Shanghai cuisine in the city â€” and theyâ€™re giving away FREE soup dumplings (xiao long bao) when you spend just $10 and free dessert! Incredible deal!ğŸ˜³ğŸŒŸ

These are the real deal â€” juicy, delicate, and handmade daily. Pair them with classic dishes like their famous juicy Peking Duck, scallion pancakes, pepper beef, or Shanghai noodles, and you're set.

Follow me @foodie.elite on IG and TikTok for more â¤ï¸

We have eaten Take Out from this place many times. This was my first time to dine in. It was FANTASTIC! Efficient and friendly associates- great team work. Nicely decorated. Food was served hot and was delicious. Love your Pork Soup Dumplings. Peking Duck. Spare ribs. Rice cake. Shrimp and Tofu. Noodles with beef were the Best! Take Out too for more Soup Dumplings and they graciously wrapped them in an insulated bag!

Have been here many years
Always have a great experience.
I love the soup dumplings and also bought the frozen back home
Affordable price, variety of food
Highly recommend
